intro: Calceolaria hollermayeri, commonly known as the Hooker's slipper orchid, is a member of the Calceolaria genus, which is part of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Andes mountains in South America, specifically in regions of Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests. Due to its delicate nature and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
